steps.title: Welcome to Guvnaville!
steps.message:
Welcome to [b]Guvnaville[/b], a post-apocalyptic city-building and strategy game!

You are the leader of a faction trying to survive and thrive in the ruins of a once-great city. You'll need to scavenge resources, build units, manage your population, and compete with other factions for dominance.

This tutorial will guide you through the basics of the game. You can skip it at any time, or replay it later from the main menu.

steps.title: The Map and Your Starting Position
steps.message:
This is the [b]game map[/b], showing the ruined city of Guvnaville.

The map is divided into tiles, each with different terrain types:
• [b]Ruins[/b]: Scavengeable areas with resources
• [b]Streets[/b]: Easy to traverse
• [b]Buildings[/b]: Strategic positions
• [b]Parks[/b]: Natural resources

Your faction starts with a [b]base[/b] and a few [b]units[/b]. Units are represented by icons on the map.

You can [b]zoom[/b] with the mouse wheel and [b]pan[/b] by clicking and dragging, or using WASD/Arrow keys.

steps.title: Understanding Resources
steps.message:
At the top of the screen is the [b]Resource Bar[/b], showing your faction's resources:

• [b]Food[/b]: Keeps your population fed. Consumed each turn.
• [b]Materials[/b]: Used for building and production.
• [b]Fuel[/b]: Powers vehicles and generators.
• [b]Medicine[/b]: Keeps population healthy.
• [b]Electronics[/b]: Advanced technology component.
• [b]Weapons[/b]: Equip combat units.

You also have [b]Population[/b], which determines how many actions you can take.

Resources are gained by [b]scavenging[/b] ruins or [b]trading[/b] with other factions.

steps.title: How to Move Units
steps.message:
Units are the backbone of your faction. They can move, scavenge, fight, and capture locations.

To move a unit:
1. [b]Click on a unit[/b] to select it
2. [b]Click on a destination tile[/b] to move there
3. Units have limited [b]movement points[/b] each turn

Try selecting one of your units and moving it to a nearby tile.

[i]Tip: Hover over units to see their stats and remaining movement.[/i]

steps.title: Scavenging Resources
steps.message:
Great! Now let's gather some resources.

[b]Scavenging[/b] is how you find resources in the ruins:
1. Move a unit to a [b]ruin tile[/b] (marked with debris)
2. Select the unit
3. Click the [b]Scavenge[/b] button
4. The unit will search and find random resources

Different locations yield different resources:
• Residential ruins → Food, Medicine
• Industrial ruins → Materials, Fuel
• Commercial ruins → Electronics, Weapons

[i]Tip: Each location can only be scavenged a limited number of times.[/i]

steps.title: Producing Units and Buildings
steps.message:
Well done! Now let's learn about [b]production[/b].

You can produce new units and buildings at your base:
1. Click on your [b]base building[/b]
2. Click the [b]Production[/b] button
3. Select what to build from the menu
4. Production takes several turns and consumes resources

Different units have different roles:
• [b]Scavengers[/b]: Fast, good at gathering resources
• [b]Soldiers[/b]: Strong in combat
• [b]Builders[/b]: Can construct buildings
• [b]Traders[/b]: Negotiate with other factions

[i]Tip: Balance your unit production based on your strategy.[/i]

steps.title: Combat Basics
steps.message:
Sometimes you'll need to [b]fight[/b] for resources and territory.

[b]Combat[/b] works like this:
1. Move a unit next to an [b]enemy unit[/b]
2. Click the [b]Attack[/b] button
3. Combat is resolved based on:
   • Unit strength
   • Terrain bonuses
   • Unit health
   • Equipped weapons

[b]Combat results[/b]:
• Winner takes minimal damage
• Loser retreats or is destroyed
• Winner may gain enemy resources

[i]Tip: Avoid combat when outnumbered. Pick battles wisely![/i]

steps.title: Culture and Progression
steps.message:
Your faction develops [b]culture[/b] over time, unlocking new abilities and bonuses.

The [b]Culture System[/b]:
• Complete actions to gain [b]Culture Points[/b]
• Spend points on the [b]Culture Tree[/b]
• Unlock technologies, bonuses, and special units
• Each faction can develop differently

Culture branches include:
• [b]Military[/b]: Combat bonuses and advanced units
• [b]Economy[/b]: Resource gathering and trade
• [b]Technology[/b]: Advanced buildings and equipment
• [b]Survival[/b]: Population growth and resilience

Click the [b]Culture[/b] button to open the culture tree.

[i]Tip: Specialize or balance - the choice is yours![/i]

steps.title: Turns and AI Opponents
steps.message:
Guvnaville is a [b]turn-based[/b] strategy game.

Each turn:
1. You take all your actions (move, scavenge, build, etc.)
2. Click [b]End Turn[/b] when ready
3. AI opponents take their turns
4. Random [b]events[/b] may occur
5. Resources are consumed/produced
6. Your turn begins again

The [b]Turn Indicator[/b] shows:
• Current turn number
• Current player
• Time of day (affects some events)

[b]AI Opponents[/b] have different personalities:
• [b]Aggressive[/b]: Attacks frequently
• [b]Defensive[/b]: Builds strong bases
• [b]Economic[/b]: Focuses on resources
• [b]Balanced[/b]: Adapts to situations

[i]Tip: Watch AI behavior to predict their strategies.[/i]

steps.title: Saving and Loading Games
steps.message:
You can [b]save[/b] your progress at any time:

• Press [b]ESC[/b] to open the menu
• Click [b]Save Game[/b]
• Give your save a name
• Continue playing or exit

[b]Quick Save/Load[/b]:
• Press [b]F5[/b] to quick save
• Press [b]F9[/b] to quick load

[b]Other useful shortcuts[/b]:
• [b]F1[/b]: Open help
• [b]Space/Enter[/b]: End turn
• [b]Tab[/b]: Cycle through units
• [b]WASD/Arrows[/b]: Pan camera
• [b]+/-[/b]: Zoom in/out

[b]Congratulations![/b] You've completed the tutorial!

You're now ready to lead your faction to victory. Good luck, and may you survive and thrive in Guvnaville!

[i]Press F1 anytime for help, or replay this tutorial from the main menu.[/i]
